_header: Thou king of weal and bliss
Subjects: hymns, to Christ; Christ, hymns to
_description: William Herebert, the hymn ‘Tu rex glorie Criste’ — six quatrains

BLAdd46919.First Lines: Þou kyng of woele and blisse louerd iesu cristþou vaderes sone of heuene þat neuer ende bist…
BLAdd46919.Last Lines: …þe poenne wee bysecheth help ous þyn oune hyneWhom wyth þy derewourþe blod hast bouth vrom helle pyne
BLAdd46919.Attributed Author: Herebert (written in left margin beside first line, by original hand, f. 208v)
BLAdd46919.Attributed Title: Tu rex glorie criste (written above text, f. 208v)
BLAdd46919.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 24-5.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 96-7.
